Mechanical Keyboard Design Guide

Welcome to the keyboard design guide at Halkowich.com (or access the latest build at Cloudflare Pages)

This guide is intended as a supplement to ai03's guide and Ruiqi Mao's guide as well as an aggregator of various sources about keyboard development. It will focus mostly on the engineering side of the hobby, but the feel of the keyboard will, of course, also be taken into consideration.

This guide will follow the development of my latest keyboard project, the Return to Sender.

This keyboard will have many features with extensive documentation including the following:

  • A detachable numpad with a battery, whcih can function as a calculator on its own.

  • RGB backlighting under every key for north-facing switches

  • A 3d printed enclosure (One of the goals with this keyboard is to make a CNC machined aluminum case)

  • At least 1 OLED display, for the calcpad.

  • A USB-C interface to connect to the computer

  • A magnetic pogopin interface to connect to the calcpad.

  • Customizable firmware via QMK or some widely used alternative such as VIA.

This website is fully open-source.
